parameters.name: TrimBoundArr
parameters.description: in-process, unmanaged C++: Pointer to an array of entities that define the trimming boundaries (see Remarks ) Solid bodies created by weldment members - or - Planar faces on non-weldment members, or planar faces on weldment members, or both VBA, VB.NET, C#, and C++/CLI: Not supported See In-process Methods for details about this type of method.

title: IWeldmentTrimExtendFeatureData.ISetTrimmingBoundary
description: Gets the entities used to define the trimming boundaries.
signature:
void ISetTrimmingBoundary( 
   System.Int32
Count
,
   ref System.Object
TrimBoundArr
)

parameters.name: TrimBoundArr
parameters.description: in-process, unmanaged C++: Pointer to an array of entities that define the trimming boundaries (see Remarks ) Solid bodies created by weldment members - or - Planar faces on non-weldment members, or planar faces on weldment members, or both VBA, VB.NET, C#, and C++/CLI: Not supported See In-process Methods for details about this type of method.

returns: Entities that define the trimming boundaries
remarks:
Faces are valid for end-trim corner types only. You can only specify multiple trimming boundaries for end-trim corner types. Use
IWeldmentTrimExtendFeatureData::CornerType
to determine the type of corner.
You must set the
bodies to trim
and set the trimming boundary if changing a corner type.
See
Accessing Selections that Define Features
for additional details.
